prompt: <description>Part 1: Rectangular Prism with a Sloped Side Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a sloped side. The prism has dimensions of 2 units in length, 1 unit in width, and 0.5 units in height. The prism is centered on a white background. 1. Create a new coordinate system with euler angles 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 and translation vector 0.0, 0.0, 0.0. Sketching on the X-Y plane, draw a rectangle with the following vertices: - Vertex 1: [0.0, 0.0] - Vertex 2: [0.75, 0.0] - Vertex 3: [0.75, 0.2753] - Vertex 4: [0.0, 0.2753] The rectangle is defined by a single face with a single loop, which is composed of 4 line segments: - Line segment 1: Connecting Vertex 1 to Vertex 2 (0.0, 0.0) to (0.75, 0.0) - Line segment 2: Connecting Vertex 2 to Vertex 3 (0.75, 0.0) to (0.75, 0.2753) - Line segment 3: Connecting Vertex 3 to Vertex 4 (0.75, 0.2753) to (0.0, 0.2753) - Line segment 4: Connecting Vertex 4 to Vertex 1 (0.0, 0.2753) to (0.0, 0.0) 2. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75. 3. Translate the resulting scaled sketch by euler angles 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 and translation vector 0.0, 0.0, 0.0, effectively moving it into 3D space. 4. Extrude the scaled sketch along the normal direction by 0.0816 units (towards the positive side of the Z-axis). 5. Extrude the scaled sketch along the opposite direction of normal (negative direction of the Z-axis) by 0.0 units. This is essentially leaving the sketch unchanged in the opposite direction. The final shape of this part will be a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a sloped side, with dimensions 0.75 units in both length and width, and 0.0816 units in height, as specified by the provided scaling factors and extrusion depths.</description>
